intro: Palafoxia texana var. robusta, commonly known as Texas palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
